#summary How to update BIOS/EC by a bootable USB stick
#labels Featured
= How to make a bootable USB stick for updating BIOS/EC in Ubuntu/Linux =
* We did't give a USB stick. You can buy many kinds of bootable USB sticks in E-markets. *

Most of B1L/B1S users can update BIOS/EC by a bootable USB stick. Please read this document as follows. 

1. Requirements :
{{{
- a USB stick (that was already formatted to FAT/FAT32)
- Biosup.img from Downloads
- Ubuntu 7.10 or 8.04
}}}

2) make a bootable USB :
{{{
1) Turn on the B1, and start the Ubuntu Linux.
2) Connect the USB stick in USB port.
3) Click 'Applications - Accessories - Terminal'
4) Check the device name about the USB stick. (ex) /dev/sda1

sudo fdisk -l

5) Copy the Biosup.img in 'HOME folder' and run this command.

sudo dd if=biosup.img of=/dev/sda1

6) After finished, restart the B1.

* If you have the USB stick over 512MB, go to the 3-1 section. If not, go to the 3-2 section.
}}}

3-1) Change the BIOS setup for the USB stick over 512MB
{{{
1) Press DEL key before disappearing the Wibrain start logo.
2) Go to 'Advanced' menu.
3) Go to 'USB Configuration' section, then press [Enter] key.
4) Go to 'USB Mass Storage Device Configuration' section, then press [Enter] key.
5) Change 'Emulation Type' to "Force FDD".
6) After finished, save settings and exit(F10). 

* After updated the BIOS/EC, please change 'Emulation Type' to "Auto".
}}}

3-2) Choose the bootable device for the USB stick under 512MB
{{{
1) Press F11 key before disappering the Wibrain start logo.
2) Choose the USB device from the device list, then press [Enter] key.
}}}

4) Boot menu in the USB stick
{{{
*************************************
* BIOS & EC Update for Ubuntu users *
*************************************

WARNING! This will update BIOS and EC for all B1 products!
Please connect D.C Power and battery when updating batch job.

BIOS changes to 1105
EC   changes to 4048

1. Update BIOS and EC now!
2. Read the revision history about BIOS and EC
3. Exit to DOS
Choose the number[1.2.3]?_
}}}
You may select the number 1, 2, 3. Check this working table and press the number.
{{{
1 : Update the BIOS/EC immediately. After updated, B1 will be turned off automatically. After done, turn on the B1 and go on a BIOS. You may find the BIOS and EC version.
2 : Read the revision history about B1. After read, press any key. You may select the Boot menu once again. 
3 : Exit to DOS. 
}}}

5) re-formatting the USB stick
{{{
After done, please re-format the USB stick. So you can use all disk space in the USB stick.
}}}
